62 // See: https://github.com/progschj/ThreadPool
63 // TODO: Implement expiration timeout
64 class ThreadPool {
65 public:
66 
67  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
70 
71  ThreadPool(uint32_t numThreads = std::thread::hardware_concurrency())
72  {
73  if (numThreads) {
74  initialize(numThreads);
75  }
76  else {
77  m_numThreads = 0;
78  }
79  }
80 
81  ~ThreadPool() {
82  shutdown();
83  throwOnFailure();
84  }

93  uint32_t maxThreadCount() const {
94  return m_numThreads.load();
95  }
96

98  return m_numActiveThreads.load();
99  }

108  uint32_t getIndex(std::thread::id threadId) {
109  std::unique_lock lock(m_threadIdMutex);
110  return m_threadIds[threadId];
111  }
112 
114  void throwOnFailure() {
115  std::unique_lock lock(m_exceptionMutex); // Need thread-safety
116  if (m_exceptionPtr) {
117  // Rethrow exception so threads don't silently fail
118  std::string exceptionStr = m_exceptionStr;
119  std::rethrow_exception(m_exceptionPtr);
120  }
121  }
122 
124  template<class F, class... Args>
125  auto addTask(F&& f, Args&&... args)
126  ->std::future<typename std::invoke_result_t<F, Args...>>
127  {
128  using return_type = typename std::invoke_result_t<F, Args...>;
129 
130  auto task = std::make_shared< std::packaged_task<return_type()> >(
131  std::bind(std::forward<F>(f), std::forward<Args>(args)...)
132  );
133 
134  std::future<return_type> res = task->get_future();
135  {
136  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(m_queueMutex);
137 
138  // Don't allow enqueueing after stopping the pool
139  if (m_shutdown.load()) {
140  throw std::runtime_error("enqueue on stopped ThreadPool");
141  }
142 
143  m_tasks.emplace([task]() { (*task)(); });
144  }
145  m_condition.notify_one();
146  return res;
147  }
148 
150  //template<>
151  //std::future<void> addTask(const std::function<void()>& f) {
152  //}
153 
155  inline void shutdown() {
156  // Break each thread's while loop
157  m_shutdown.store(true);
158  m_condition.notify_all();
159 
160  // Join each thread
161  for (std::thread& t : m_threads) {
162  // Check if joinable, in which case threads are not already joined
163  if (t.joinable()) {
164  t.join();
165  }
166  }
167 
168  m_shutdown.store(false);
169  }
170 
172 
173 private:
174  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
177 
178  inline void initialize(uint32_t numThreads) {
179  if (m_threads.size()) {
180  // If already initialized, shutdown the running threads
181  shutdown();
182  }
183 
184  std::unique_lock lock(m_threadIdMutex);
185  m_threadIds.clear();
186  for (uint32_t i = 0; i < numThreads; i++) {
187  m_threads.push_back(std::thread(&ThreadPool::safeTaskLoop, this));
188  m_threadIds[m_threads.back().get_id()] = i;
189  }
190  m_numThreads.store(numThreads);
191  }
192 
194  void safeTaskLoop() {
195  try {
196  taskLoop();
197  }
198  catch (...) {
199  // Catch any errors so that they can be thrown again on the main thread
200  std::unique_lock lock(m_exceptionMutex);
201  m_exceptionPtr = std::current_exception();
202  }
203  }
204 
207  inline void taskLoop() {
208  // Increment active thread count on thread start
209  m_numActiveThreads.fetch_add(1);
210 
211  while (true) {
212  std::function<void()> task;
213  {
214  // Wait causes the current thread to block until the condition variable is notified
215  // The predicate passed into the wait routine gives behavior equivalent to:
216  // while(!pred()){wait(lock);}
217 
218  // Reduce active thread count while waiting
219  m_numActiveThreads.fetch_sub(1);
220 
221  // Once the wait condition is reached, this thread will own the lock
222  std::unique_lock lock(m_queueMutex);
223  m_condition.wait(lock, [this] {return !m_tasks.empty() || m_shutdown.load(); });
224 
225  if (m_shutdown && m_tasks.empty()) {
226  // No tasks and is shutting down, so break the loop
227  return;
228  }
229 
230  // Increment active thread count since no longer waiting
231  m_numActiveThreads.fetch_add(1);
232 
233  // Remove the first-added task from the queue to perform it
234  task = std::move(m_tasks.front());
235  m_tasks.pop();
236  }
237 
238  // Perform the task
239  task();
240  }
241  }
